results_summary: 35e showed significant antilipid accumulation and antifibrotic effects in both MCD and Western diet-induced NASH models, with short-term treatment effectively regulating ALT/AST levels and inflammation, though long-term antisteatotic effects were inconsistent.
population_specificity: Mice with diet-induced NASH (methionine- and choline-deficient or Western diet).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of choline chloride on social behaviors, neuroinflammation, and histopathological changes in a rat model of autism induced by prenatal LPS exposure.
results_summary: Choline chloride treatment improved social novelty and passive avoidance learning in male rats, reduced neuroinflammatory markers (TNF-α, IL-2, IL-17), and showed sex-dependent effects on neurotrophic and neurotransmission pathways. Histological improvements in gliosis were observed in hippocampal and cerebellar regions.
population_specificity: Rat model of LPS-induced autism (prenatal exposure, postnatal treatment).
study_duration: From postnatal day 5 (PN5) to PN50 (45 days).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the lack of choline (Cho) elevation in grade II-III gliomas and its implications for diagnosing cancerous lesions using MRS.
results_summary: The study found that a significant proportion of grade II-III gliomas did not exhibit elevated choline levels, challenging the assumption that Cho elevation is a universal marker for cancerous lesions. The Cho/NAA ratio was significantly higher in WHO II glial tumours compared to no-choline elevation cases.
population_specificity: 89 cases of grade II (83%) and grade III (17%) gliomas (astrocytoma or oligodendroglioma).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of 11C-Choline PET imaging in assessing early response to androgen receptor-targeting agents (ARTA) and its prognostic value for biochemical progression-free survival (bPFS) and overall survival (OS) in metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer (mCRPC) patients.
results_summary: The study found that 11C-Choline PET parameters, particularly maximum standardized uptake value at the first scan, had a significant prognostic correlation with overall survival (OS). However, primary correlations with biochemical response were more strongly associated with 68Ga-PSMA PET parameters.
population_specificity: Patients with metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer (mCRPC) treated with ARTA.
effective_dosage: Not specified (PET scan administered once before therapy and once 2 months later).
study_duration: Two PET scans separated by 2 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if preoperative MRI and PET, including 11C-choline PET, could differentiate IDH status in non-enhanced astrocytic tumors.
results_summary: The study found that the tumor/normal brain uptake (T/N) ratio for 11C-choline PET was significantly higher in IDH-wildtype tumors compared to IDH-mutant tumors, aiding in diagnostic accuracy.
population_specificity: 82 patients with non-contrast-enhanced, diffuse, supratentorial astrocytic tumors (55 IDH-mutant, 27 IDH-wildtype).

study_goal: To evaluate whether annual course therapy of choline alfoscerate (CA) can slow or prevent the progression of amnesic mild cognitive impairment (aMCI) to dementia and identify predictors of its preventive effect.
results_summary: The study found that CA therapy significantly reduced cognitive deficit progression (12.2% vs. 39.1%) and conversion to dementia (8.2% vs. 26.1%) compared to the control group, with statistically significant improvements in cognitive functioning over three years.
population_specificity: 100 patients with amnesic mild cognitive impairment (aMCI).
effective_dosage: 1000 mg (4 ml) intravenous infusion in 100 ml saline solution daily for 4 weeks, administered once annually.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of Erchen Decoction (ECD) on preventing non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH) in mice and explore its mechanism, with choline deficiency used to induce NASH in the model group.
results_summary: The study found that choline deficiency (MCD diet) led to increased liver injury markers (ALT, AST), inflammation (IL-1β, IL-6, TNF-α), and lipid accumulation, while ECD administration improved these parameters, likely via activation of the Nrf2/GPX4 pathway.
population_specificity: C57BL/6 male mice
effective_dosage: Methionine and choline-deficient (MCD) diet for the model group; methionine and choline-supplemented (MCS) diet for the control group.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how tangeretin, a polymethoxyflavone, modulates gut microbiota to inhibit choline conversion to TMA and reduce cardiovascular inflammation.
results_summary: Tangeretin reduced CutC-active bacteria (e.g., Clostridiaceae and Lactobacillus), lowering choline-to-TMA conversion and mitigating cardiovascular inflammation caused by prolonged choline consumption.
population_specificity: Rat models

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the relationship between cholinesterase (ChE) activity, choline metabolism, and the tumor immune microenvironment in lung cancer, as well as their impact on immunotherapy response and resistance.
results_summary: High baseline ChE levels and ChE elevation after immunotherapy were associated with better survival outcomes in advanced NSCLC. A choline metabolism-related gene signature (MTHFD1, PDGFB, PIK3R3, CHKB) correlated with poorer prognosis, immunosuppressive tumor microenvironment, and immune escape, with MTHFD1 implicated in macrophage differentiation and endothelial cell proliferation.
population_specificity: 277 advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) patients receiving first-line immunotherapy.
study_duration: Alteration of ChE was assessed after 2 courses of immunotherapy (exact duration not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop an innovative sensor (SPOOC) for accurate at-home measurement of choline levels in infant formulas to ensure adequate nutritional intake.
results_summary: The study reported that SPOOC provided rapid and accurate assessment of choline levels in infant formulas without sample treatment, enabling parents to monitor choline intake effectively. The sensor integrated a potentiometric system and wireless data transmission to mobile devices.
population_specificity: Infants (focus on choline intake via infant formulas and milk powders).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the chemical components, core targets, and molecular mechanisms of Shugan Xiaozhi (SGXZ) decoction in improving nonalcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH).
results_summary: SGXZ decoction improved liver damage, fibrosis, and lipid metabolism in NASH mouse models by targeting apoptosis-related pathways and suppressing the TLR4/MyD88/NF-κB pathway. Key components like quercetin, luteolin, and kaempferol interacted with core targets such as TNF-α, IL-6, and IL-1β.
population_specificity: MCD-induced NASH mouse models

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of rumen-protected choline (RPC) on lactation performance and metabolic health in dairy cows during prepartum and postpartum periods.
results_summary: RPC supplementation increased milk yield, milk components, and plasma choline concentrations while reducing hepatic triacylglycerol content and hyperketonemia incidence in multiparous cows. Benefits were more pronounced when RPC was fed both before and after calving.
population_specificity: Nulliparous and parous Holstein dairy cows
study_duration: Experiment 1: 25 days prepartum to 80 days postpartum; Experiment 2: last 22 days of gestation only

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of pulsed electric field (PEF) pre-treatment on the extraction of metabolites from cocoa bean shells using choline chloride-lactic acid natural deep eutectic solvent (NaDES) and assess the bioactivity of the resulting extract.
results_summary: The PEF-assisted extraction method improved the release of total polyphenols (TPC) by up to 45% and total flavonoids (TFC) by up to 48% compared to conventional extraction. The extract showed medium growth inhibition of Escherichia coli and high growth inhibition of Salmonella sp, Listeria monocytogenes, and Staphylococcus aureus.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study on cocoa bean shell extracts)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the impact of synthetic and natural choline supplementation on broiler performance, carcass quality, blood parameters, and hepatic steatosis.
results_summary: Natural choline source A (NCA) outperformed synthetic choline chloride (CC) and natural choline source B (NCB), improving body weight gain and feed conversion ratio while reducing hepatic steatosis. NCA at 100g/t was particularly effective compared to other doses and sources.
population_specificity: Male Cobb 500 broiler chicks (1 to 42 days old).
effective_dosage: 400g/t, 800g/t, and 1200g/t of CC; 100g/t, 200g/t, and 300g/t of NCA and NCB.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether CDP-choline could reduce or prevent liver and kidney damage caused by Amanita phalloides poisoning in rats.
results_summary: CDP-choline significantly and dose-dependently reduced liver damage caused by Amanita phalloides poisoning and showed a non-significant tendency to mitigate kidney damage.
population_specificity: Male Wistar Albino rats
effective_dosage: 100 mg/kg, 250 mg/kg, and 500 mg/kg, administered intraperitoneally
study_duration: Single administration at the 2nd hour, with sacrifice at the 6th hour

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of choline and CDP-choline on endotoxin-induced hemostatic alterations in dogs using thromboelastography (TEG).
results_summary: Choline and CDP-choline attenuated or prevented endotoxin-induced alterations in TEG parameters, with CDP-choline being more effective. The treatments improved clot formation, stability, and overall coagulation in endotoxemic dogs.
population_specificity: Endotoxemic dogs
effective_dosage: Choline (20 mg/kg, iv), CDP-choline (70 mg/kg, iv)
study_duration: Measurements taken before and at 0.5-48 hours after treatment

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify acute and long-term changes in biological processes regulated by developmental iron deficiency and modifiable by prenatal choline supplementation.
results_summary: Prenatal choline supplementation partially mitigated early-life iron deficiency-induced gene dysregulation and altered the hippocampal transcriptome in iron-sufficient rats, with both beneficial and adverse effects noted.
population_specificity: Male rat offspring from pregnant rats fed an iron-deficient or iron-sufficient diet.
study_duration: From gestational day 11 to gestational day 18.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of choline and Prunus mume on liver function and metabolic markers in NAFLD patients over a three-month period.
results_summary: The study found that choline and Prunus mume significantly improved liver function (ALT, AST, γ-GT), glucose metabolism (FPG, HbA1c), and lipid profiles (HDL-Ch, triglycerides), with HRI reductions indicating reduced NAFLD severity.
population_specificity: 168 patients with non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the therapeutic potential of a liposome nanomedicine containing CDP-choline for treating post-ischemic events caused by brain stroke.
results_summary: The study found that CDP-choline/OX26Lip significantly improved survival rates (96% vs. 78%) and reduced peroxidation rates (~5-times) compared to CDP-choline/Lip, demonstrating enhanced efficacy in post-ischemic rats. The nanomedicine also showed stable pharmacokinetic properties and increased brain tissue accumulation of CDP-choline.
population_specificity: Re-perfused post-ischemic rats

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether prenatal choline supplementation could mitigate cognitive deficits caused by alcohol exposure in a sheep model of fetal alcohol spectrum disorders (FASD).
results_summary: Alcohol exposure impaired T-maze reversal learning in lambs, but choline supplementation mitigated these deficits in the heavy binge alcohol group (HBA-CH). No differences were observed during acquisition training.
population_specificity: Pregnant sheep (as a model for human FASD) and their offspring.
effective_dosage: 10 mg/kg choline administered orally throughout each day of gestation.

study_goal: The abstract does not mention Choline or its effects.
results_summary: The abstract does not discuss Choline or its effects.
population_specificity: Not specified (abstract discusses hyperparathyroidism and hypercalcemia).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether supplementation with alpha-glycerylphosphorycholine (A-GPC) could enhance cognitive performance in healthy, resistance-trained males.
results_summary: Both high-dose (630 mg) and low-dose (315 mg) A-GPC supplementation significantly improved cognitive performance, as measured by Stroop test scores and completion times, compared to placebo. The effects were statistically significant, with a moderate effect size.
population_specificity: 20 resistance-trained males (aged 31.3 ± 11.0 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the role of choline kinase in cancer processes and explore the potential of choline kinase inhibitors as anti-tumor drugs.
results_summary: The study found that choline kinases (CHKα and CHKβ) are involved in cancer cell proliferation and discussed their clinical aspects in various tumor types. It also examined the potential of CHKα inhibitors as anti-tumor agents, though they are not yet in clinical trials.
population_specificity: Various cancer types (pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma, ovarian cancer, lung adenocarcinoma, lymphoma, leukemia, hepatocellular carcinoma, colon adenocarcinoma, breast cancer) and non-cancerous diseases.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the association between gut microbiome dysbiosis, including choline metabolites, and non-communicable diseases (NCDs) in people with HIV (PWH).
results_summary: Choline metabolites were associated with cardiovascular outcomes and chronic liver disease (CLD) in PWH, suggesting a potential role in NCD pathogenesis. The study did not provide detailed efficacy data specific to choline supplementation.
population_specificity: People with HIV (PWH) aged >18 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of choline supplementation on cognitive function, neurodegenerative diseases, and its role in reducing amyloid-β deposition and improving brain pathways.
results_summary: Choline supplementation showed beneficial effects in reducing amyloid-plaque load and improving spatial memory in an APP/PS1 mice model of Alzheimer's disease. It also enhanced cognitive function in adults, though not significantly, and may improve memory performance and synaptic functioning in early neurodegenerative diseases when combined with existing treatments.
population_specificity: Adults and APP/PS1 mice model of Alzheimer's disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficiency and economic burden of FCh-PET/CT versus MIBI scintigraphy in preoperative localization for minimally invasive parathyroidectomy in patients with primary hyperparathyroidism.
results_summary: FCh-PET/CT reduced imaging time by 83% and surgery time by 41% when intraoperative parathyroid hormone monitoring was not used, with no significant difference in surgery time between the two methods. It also potentially reduced reoperations for persistent disease.
population_specificity: Patients with primary hyperparathyroidism undergoing surgery (234 for MIBI scintigraphy, 163 for FCh-PET/CT).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of a synbiotic mixture, including choline, on tissue metabolism and clinical features in post-COVID-19 ME/CFS patients.
results_summary: The synbiotic significantly increased choline levels in the thalamus compared to placebo, suggesting improved tissue metabolism. It also attenuated post-exercise malaise and improved creatine levels in specific brain regions.
population_specificity: Twenty-six post-COVID-19 ME/CFS patients.
effective_dosage: Not specified for choline alone (synbiotic mixture included multiple components).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the role of cholinesterase inhibitors, including choline-related compounds, in treating Alzheimer's disease by focusing on heterocyclic rings with cholinesterase inhibitory activity.
results_summary: The study highlights that cholinesterase inhibitors, which maintain choline levels in the synaptic gap, are crucial for symptomatic treatment of Alzheimer's disease. It emphasizes the need for more effective cholinesterase inhibitors, reviewing recent chemical structures and their structure-activity relationships.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on Alzheimer's disease research).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare cardiovascular adverse events (AEs) associated with memantine and cholinesterase inhibitors, including potential sex differences in these AEs.
results_summary: Cholinesterase inhibitors showed signals for bradycardia, myocardial infarction, atrial fibrillation, and cardiac arrest compared to memantine, while memantine was associated with higher rates of cardiac failure and deep vein thrombosis. Female patients reported more cardiovascular AEs overall, with specific sex differences noted for certain conditions.
population_specificity: Patients receiving antidementia medications (memantine or cholinesterase inhibitors) as reported in the FDA Adverse Event Reporting System database.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of two different folic acid doses (400 μg/day vs. 800 μg/day) on folate and one-carbon metabolism biomarkers in maternal and cord blood during pregnancy.
results_summary: The study found that folic acid dose significantly affected certain folate and one-carbon biomarkers, with differing effects between maternal and cord blood. The long-term implications of these findings remain unknown.
population_specificity: Healthy pregnant women (<12 weeks gestation at enrollment).
study_duration: From first prenatal visit (<12 weeks gestation) through delivery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the prognostic value of imaging markers, including Choline concentrations in magnetic resonance spectroscopy, for predicting poor neurological outcomes and mortality in acute traumatic brain injury (TBI).
results_summary: The study identified Choline as one of several brain metabolites examined in magnetic resonance spectroscopy, but it did not specifically highlight its individual prognostic value compared to other markers like subarachnoid hemorrhage (SAH) or subdural hematoma (SDH).
population_specificity: Patients with acute traumatic brain injury (TBI).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the historical development, clinical applications, and translational potential of Choline And Geranic acid (CAGE) as a biocompatible ionic liquid for drug delivery.
results_summary: CAGE has demonstrated broad applicability in drug delivery, including transdermal, oral, and buccal routes, with successful Phase 1 and Phase 2 clinical trials involving over 200 patients, including a Phase 2 study in Atopic Dermatitis patients. It is the first ionic liquid-based drug delivery system to enter clinical trials.
population_specificity: Patients in clinical trials, including those with Atopic Dermatitis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and tolerability of varenicline and bupropion as first-line pharmacotherapies for smoking cessation.
results_summary: The study found that varenicline and bupropion are effective for smoking cessation, with varenicline showing superior efficacy in maintaining abstinence and reducing cravings compared to bupropion. Adverse effects were generally mild to moderate and manageable.
population_specificity: Individuals seeking smoking cessation treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review metabolomics techniques and their application in saliva analysis for diagnosing and understanding oral diseases, including the role of metabolites like choline.
results_summary: Choline was identified as one of the frequently reported metabolites in saliva metabolomics studies related to oral diseases, but no specific effects or outcomes of choline were detailed.
population_specificity: Patients with periodontal diseases, oral squamous cell carcinoma, and Sjögren Syndrome.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of acetylcholine (ACh) and the non-neuronal cholinergic system (NNCS) in skin health, focusing on synthesis, receptor interactions, degradation, and therapeutic modulation strategies.
results_summary: The study highlights the NNCS's essential functions in maintaining epidermal barrier integrity, wound healing, microcirculation, and inflammatory responses, and discusses its potential as a therapeutic target for skin diseases like psoriasis, atopic dermatitis, and acne. However, clinical translation remains uncertain due to the complexity of cholinergic signaling and lack of comprehensive human studies.
population_specificity: Skin cells (keratinocytes, endothelial cells, fibroblasts, macrophages, immune cells) and implications for skin diseases.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the impact of PET-PSMA imaging on prostate cancer management, including its diagnostic accuracy and clinical utility.
results_summary: The study found that PET-PSMA imaging significantly improves diagnostic accuracy and clinical utility in prostate cancer management, outperforming conventional imaging modalities. It highlights advancements in PSMA-targeted radiotracers and optimized imaging protocols.
population_specificity: Patients with prostate cancer at various stages.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the toxicity and effectiveness of a moderately hypofractionated radiotherapy schedule with focal boosts using 18F-choline PET-CT for staging and boost volume definition in prostate cancer patients.
results_summary: The study found that focal boosts with a 20-fraction hypofractionated schedule resulted in low gastrointestinal toxicity (6.6% acute, 5.0% late) and manageable urinary toxicity (49.2% acute, 30.1% late), with good cancer control (88.5% bDFS, 82.4% MFS, 91.2% OS at 5 years).
population_specificity: Intermediate- to very high-risk localized prostate cancer patients with bulky tumor volumes.
effective_dosage: 60Gy in 20 fractions with a boost dose up to 68Gy; pelvic lymph node radiotherapy (45Gy elective, up to 50Gy involved nodes for positive nodes).
study_duration: Radiotherapy completed with hormone therapy (range: 6-36 months).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the metabolic footprint of liver fibrosis using metabolomic approaches.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings related to Choline's effects.
population_specificity: Not specified in the abstract.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of gut microbe-dependent metabolites, including choline, in the initiation and progression of fibrosis across multiple organ systems.
results_summary: The study found that gut microbiota convert dietary choline into trimethylamine (TMA), which is further metabolized to TMAO, a compound associated with vascular injury and enhanced fibrosis in conditions like chronic kidney disease and heart failure. The abstract does not provide direct efficacy data on choline itself but highlights its metabolic pathway's potential role in fibrosis.
population_specificity: Not specified (broadly refers to chronic diseases like kidney disease, heart failure, and liver disease).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify organic cation transporters involved in choline uptake and characterize their transport activities.
results_summary: The study found that SLC35G4 and SLC35F5 significantly increased choline uptake, while other SLC transporters also facilitated choline transport alongside other organic cations.
population_specificity: HEK293 cells (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of a probiotic formulation (containing Levilactobacillus brevis P30021 and Lactiplantibacillus plantarum P30025) on cognitive performance, mood, and neurotransmitter production, including choline, in moderately stressed healthy adults.
results_summary: The probiotic formulation showed a significant beneficial effect on depressive symptoms and rumination but had no effect on subjective stress measures. No relevant correlations were observed between neurotransmitter concentrations (including choline) and cognitive or mood outcomes.
population_specificity: Moderately stressed healthy adults (mean age 29 ± 5.7 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the neuroprotective effects of choline in the context of traumatic brain injury (TBI) outcomes and assess its potential role in supplementation and dietary protocols.
results_summary: The abstract suggests choline is among the compounds under investigation for its neuroprotective effects in TBI, but specific results regarding its efficacy are not detailed. The review highlights the potential of various nutrients, including choline, to mitigate TBI-related damage.
population_specificity: Individuals affected by or at high risk for traumatic brain injuries (TBIs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the association between gut microbiota metabolites, including choline, and the development of hepatobiliary cancers (HCC and CCA).
results_summary: The abstract suggests a potential association between microbial metabolites like choline and the pathogenesis of cholangiocarcinoma (CCA), but no specific effects or mechanisms are detailed. The role of choline in HCC is not explicitly mentioned.
population_specificity: Patients with hepatobiliary malignancies (HCC and CCA).

study_goal: To analyze the effectiveness of choline alfoscerate and EMHPS as nootropic therapy for patients with chronic cerebral circulation insufficiency (CCCI).
results_summary: The combination of EMHPS with choline alfoscerate improved endothelial function, reduced asthenic syndrome, stress, depression, and anxiety, and had a positive effect on cognitive impairment and complication progression.
population_specificity: Patients with chronic cerebral circulation insufficiency (CCCI).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify specific biomarkers, including choline, associated with aortic dissection (AD) and explore underlying metabolic pathways.
results_summary: The study found that choline, along with serine and uridine, was frequently involved in AD, suggesting a correlation with metabolic dysregulation in amino acid and lipid pathways. However, the study did not establish causality or specific therapeutic effects of choline.
population_specificity: Human subjects with aortic dissection (specific demographics not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the role of nuclear imaging techniques, including choline tracers, in detecting incidentalomas and their impact on patient management.
results_summary: PET/CT with choline tracers showed high incidentaloma detection rates, particularly in neuroendocrine tumors and prostate cancer, leading to therapeutic strategy changes in 59% of cases.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing nuclear medicine studies with incidental tumor findings.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize current knowledge on the mechanisms of liver fibrosis in lean NAFLD, particularly focusing on models like methionine/choline-deficient (MCD) diets.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results about Choline's effects but mentions that MCD diets are commonly used to model lean NAFLD.
population_specificity: Lean NAFLD models (animal or human not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of choline metabolism by gut microbes, particularly focusing on the formation of TMAO and its systemic effects on human health.
results_summary: The study found that TMAO, a metabolite derived from choline, contributes to systemic inflammation, ER stress, mitochondrial stress, and disruption of physiological functions, highlighting its potential as a biomarker and therapeutic target.
population_specificity: Not specified (general human physiology focus).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze current trends in choline intake in European and non-European populations and discuss possible future trends.
results_summary: Choline intake in most European and non-European populations was insufficient, not exceeding 80% of the AI standard value. The main dietary sources were animal products, with future intake trends potentially influenced by changes in meat and egg consumption and the rise of plant-based products.
population_specificity: Adults in European and non-European countries, including pregnant women.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the epigenetic influence of the traditional Korean diet (K-diet), including choline intake, on global DNA methylation via one-carbon metabolism.
results_summary: The K-diet group consumed more choline compared to the control group, which was associated with increased global DNA methylation and improved one-carbon metabolism markers like plasma 5-methyltetrahydrofolate and reduced L-homocysteine.
population_specificity: 52 women
study_duration: 4 weeks per dietary intervention with a 4-week washout period

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify genetic biomarkers, including those related to choline dehydrogenase (CHDH), associated with acamprosate treatment response in alcohol use disorder (AUD).
results_summary: The study identified genetic variants in IL17RB and CHDH linked to acamprosate treatment outcomes, with certain genotypes associated with lower IL17RB expression and protective effects against alcohol relapse.
population_specificity: 442 patients with alcohol use disorder (AUD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess whether a nutritional intervention containing choline, DHA, and UMP could improve brain development and neurodevelopmental outcomes in very and extremely preterm infants.
results_summary: The study found that supplementation with the nutrient blend was associated with clinically meaningful improvements in cognitive, attention, and language scores in preterm infants, though the primary outcome (white matter integrity) was still under investigation.
population_specificity: Infants born at less than 30 weeks of gestation.
study_duration: From term-equivalent age to 12 months corrected age.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze and summarize the primary indications of PET/CT in endocrine diseases, excluding neuroendocrine carcinomas, and compare different radiopharmaceuticals.
results_summary: The study concluded that PET/CT is valuable for diagnosing and managing endocrine disorders due to its ability to provide functional and anatomical information, detect lesions early, guide treatment, and monitor response. It highlighted the non-invasive nature and precision of PET/CT in modern endocrine healthcare.
population_specificity: Patients with endocrine diseases (excluding neuroendocrine carcinomas).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess neuroimmune markers, including choline-containing compounds, in individuals with substance use disorders (SUDs) to understand their role in SUD pathophysiology and treatment.
results_summary: The study found that choline-containing compounds, along with other neuroimmune markers, contribute to understanding neuroinflammation in SUDs, including temporal dynamics (acute vs. chronic use) and potential treatment targets.
population_specificity: Individuals with substance use disorders (SUDs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the performance of 18 F-PSMA-1007 and 18 F-fluorocholine (FCH) PET/CT in identifying metastatic lesions in prostate cancer patients with biochemical recurrence.
results_summary: The study found that 18 F-PSMA-1007 demonstrated significantly higher SUV max values and better performance in identifying metastatic lesions compared to FCH. Both tracers showed moderate correlations with PSA levels, but 18 F-PSMA-1007 had stronger associations with PSA velocity.
population_specificity: 106 prostate cancer patients with biochemical recurrence who had undergone primary definitive treatment.
study_duration: Patients underwent one PSMA and one FCH PET/CT examination within 10 days, with a minimum follow-up of 6 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize choline's metabolic pathways, its roles in diseases like NAFLD and cancer, and evaluate current therapeutic agents targeting choline metabolism.
results_summary: Choline participates in oxidation, phosphorylation, and acetylation pathways, influencing methyl metabolism, lipid transport, and neurotransmission. Gut microbiota metabolizes choline into compounds linked to diseases like NAFLD and cancer, but current therapeutic agents targeting choline metabolism are largely ineffective or have adverse effects.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of choline metabolism and disease implications).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the use of choline as a targeting ligand for directing nanoparticles to brain endothelial cells to enhance drug delivery across the blood-brain barrier.
results_summary: The abstract highlights that choline, among other ligands, has been used to target nanoparticles to brain endothelial cells, demonstrating enhanced brain-targeted delivery with improved transport to specific cell types. However, some nanoparticles still accumulate in peripheral organs, indicating room for improvement in targeting efficiency.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing studies)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the clinical utility of choline and other 1-C metabolism-related biomolecules as potential biomarkers and supplements in medically assisted reproduction (MAR).
results_summary: The study suggested that 1-C metabolism-related processes, including those involving choline, may be compromised in IVF-derived embryos, but specific efficacy data on choline were not highlighted. The level of evidence for choline's role in MAR was noted to be low, requiring further verification.
population_specificity: Individuals undergoing medically assisted reproduction (MAR), particularly those using in vitro fertilization (IVF) techniques.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the role of dietary factors, genetic variants related to folate-mediated one-carbon metabolism (FOCM), and potential nutrient-gene interactions in colorectal cancer (CRC) risk, with a focus on choline.
results_summary: High dietary intake of betaine was associated with a decreased risk of CRC. Two SNPs (rs1476413 and rs17824591) showed significant gene-diet interactions with total choline and vitamin B.
population_specificity: 229 CRC patients and 229 age- and sex-matched controls from a population-based bowel cancer screening program.
interactions: Gene-diet interactions with total choline and vitamin B were noted.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the relationships between gut microbiota-related metabolites (including choline) and measures of glycemia, dyslipidemia, adiposity, and incident type 2 diabetes in Hispanic populations.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results regarding choline's effects, only mentioning its inclusion as a measured metabolite in the study.
population_specificity: Hispanic participants from the Boston Puerto Rican Health Study (BPRHS) and the San Juan Overweight Adult Longitudinal Study (SOALS).
study_duration: 3 years for SOALS, 6 years for BPRHS

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of choline in epigenetic modifications, particularly DNA methylation, and its potential impact on fetal development and lifelong health.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results regarding choline's effects, only mentioning its inclusion as a micronutrient of interest in epigenetic research.
population_specificity: Not specified in the abstract.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the impact of maternal psychological distress on fetal brain development, including changes in brain metabolites like choline.
results_summary: The study found that maternal psychological distress is associated with decreased brain metabolites, including choline, which may contribute to disrupted fetal and neonatal brain development and long-term neurobehavioral dysfunction.
population_specificity: Pregnant women and their offspring.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the beneficial effects of choline in cellular metabolism, inflammatory pathways, and its role in cardiometabolic disorders and cognitive function.
results_summary: Choline deficiency is linked to NAFLD and cognitive disability, while excess intake increases TMAO levels, potentially contributing to atherosclerosis, CVD, and CKD. A balanced choline diet is crucial for preventing these disorders.
population_specificity: General human health, with implications for cardiometabolic and cognitive disorders.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the anti-shock effects, toxicity, and pharmacokinetic characteristics of anisodamine to better understand its medicinal value and guide clinical applications.
results_summary: The study highlights anisodamine's diverse pharmacological effects, including cholinolytic, calcium antagonist, and anti-oxygenation properties, with moderate efficacy and low toxicity in clinical applications, particularly for shock treatment. However, gaps remain in understanding its in vivo pharmacokinetics, mechanism of action, and toxicity.
population_specificity: Not specified (general clinical applications, particularly shock treatment).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of non-neuronal cholinergic systems, particularly in immune cells, and the potential of α7 nAChRs as a therapeutic target.
results_summary: The study found that acetylcholine (ACh) functions not only as a neurotransmitter but also as a local regulator in non-neuronal cells, including immune cells, with α7 nAChRs on macrophages and T cells playing a key role in regulating inflammatory and immune responses.
population_specificity: Mammalian cells, including immune cells, keratinocytes, vascular endothelial cells, cardiac myocytes, and epithelial cells.

study_goal: The abstract does not mention Choline or its effects.
results_summary: The abstract does not discuss Choline or its effects.
population_specificity: Not specified (abstract does not mention Choline).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the diagnostic performance of PSMA-PET with conventional imaging and choline PET in prostate cancer management.
results_summary: The study found that PSMA-PET offers superior sensitivity and specificity compared to choline PET and conventional imaging, consolidating bone and soft tissue evaluation into a single study. Choline PET was implied to be less effective than PSMA-PET for prostate cancer imaging.
population_specificity: Patients with prostate cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if choline or phosphatidylcholine (PC) deficiency is a plausible factor in necrotizing enterocolitis (NEC) in preterm infants.
results_summary: The study found that low choline/PC status in preterm infants is linked to factors associated with NEC risk and suggests that additional choline or PC may reduce NEC incidence.
population_specificity: Preterm infants

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of choline alfoscerate (a choline-containing compound) in activating fat metabolism for submental fat reduction.
results_summary: The study noted that glycerophosphorylcholine containing choline alfoscerate claims to activate fat metabolism, but the abstract does not provide specific efficacy data or clinical outcomes for choline itself.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion on submental fat reduction in plastic surgery/dermatology).
